activities.question: Let's master the plural forms of Swahili nouns! Swahili uses noun classes to form plurals, making it systematic and logical.

How Swahili Plurals Work: The Noun Class System

üìã THE PATTERN:
Swahili nouns belong to different 'classes' based on their prefixes (letters at the start). Each class has its own formula for forming plurals:

1Ô∏è‚É£ M-WA CLASS (People)
Formula: M- ‚Üí WA-
Example: Mtu ‚Üí Watu (person ‚Üí people)
Rule: Remove M-, add WA-

2Ô∏è‚É£ M-MI CLASS (Plants & Objects)
Formula: M- ‚Üí MI-
Example: Mti ‚Üí Miti (tree ‚Üí trees)
Rule: Remove M-, add MI-

3Ô∏è‚É£ KI-VI CLASS (Small Things)
Formula: KI- ‚Üí VI-
Example: Kiti ‚Üí Viti (chair ‚Üí chairs)
Rule: Remove KI-, add VI-

4Ô∏è‚É£ N-N CLASS (No Change)
Formula: SAME FORM
Example: Nyumba ‚Üí Nyumba (house ‚Üí houses)
Rule: Singular and plural look identical!

üí° THE KEY:
‚Ä¢ Look at the PREFIX (start of the word)
‚Ä¢ Identify which CLASS it belongs to
‚Ä¢ Apply the CLASS FORMULA
‚Ä¢ The rest of the word stays the same!

‚ú® Example:
Mtoto (child) ‚Üí M- prefix ‚Üí M-WA class ‚Üí Remove M-, add WA- ‚Üí Watoto (children)

Now let's practice with real examples!
M-WA Class (People)
activities.description: The most common class for people and living beings

activities.question: M-MI Class (Plants & Objects)
activities.description: Used for trees, plants, and some objects

activities.question: KI-VI Class (Small Things & Objects)
activities.description: Used for small objects, tools, and diminutives

activities.question: N-N Class (Animals & Things)
activities.description: Nouns that don't change form between singular and plural

activities.question: What is the plural of 'mtu' (person)?
activities.explanation: Mtu becomes watu in plural. The M-WA class is used for people.

activities.question: What is the plural of 'kiti' (chair)?
activities.explanation: Kiti becomes viti in plural. The KI-VI class is used for objects and tools.

activities.question: Which noun keeps the same form in plural?
activities.explanation: Ndege stays the same in plural. It belongs to the N-N class.

activities.question: What is the plural of 'mwalimu' (teacher)?
activities.explanation: Mwalimu becomes walimu. People words use the M-WA class.

activities.question: What is the plural of 'mlango' (door)?
activities.explanation: Mlango becomes milango. The M-MI class is used for objects and plants.
